website_summaries.verdict: They’re a bit pricey, but the overall quality is good. A sound choice if you need comfortable crew socks with a bit of extra support for working out or long days spent standing.
pros: Strategic padding maximizes comfort without adding unnecessary bulk
Features antimicrobial technology to prevent odor causing bacteria
Effectively absorbs moisture, keeps feet dry throughout the day
cons: Some owners feel they could be a bit thicker

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return them, but I already wore a pair once.
customer_reviews.text: I really love Under Armor but these socks wore out after wearing them a single time, I thought it would be just one pair that could be poorly made, but all of them look like they’ve been worn for months after a single wear. All the threads are coming loose. I think Adidas crew socks are a better choice especially because they’ve lasted me 4 years through construction work and football season.
customer_reviews.author: UM9270

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: These socks SUCK. At first I was impressed with comfort but I've been at my desk for about 7 to 8 hours making a few trips to the bathroom or kitchen. When I put my shoes on to go out, I saw the threads falling off the sock. This is unacceptable quality. 8 hours AT MOST and they look like this? Ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap product. Will not last long after opening the package!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting a deal too good to be true. And it was to good to be true. I tried ona set of these socks and within a few hours they started fraying and looking like they were ten years old! I thought maybe it was just this set I tried on. So I put another set on and guess what...they too started fraying. After a wash they were even worse! I do not recommend you purchase these unless you only want a few hours of use from them.
customer_reviews.author: Gwetoe

customer_reviews.title: check your order for poor quality knockoff socks
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased these socks twice, and after they've been worn from three to eight months, we have decided all 12 pairs are fakes. A wise shopper will check the socks prior to unpackaging to ensure they're getting what they paid for. The image showing fraying, pilling, and a box of different knitting around the logo is showing the knockoff socks. The image showing an undamaged sock with no variation in knitting around the logo is showing actual Under Armour socks, purchased elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Karen.

customer_reviews.title: With great breathability comes great disappointment...
customer_reviews.text: So I have sweaty, stinky feet. Its a fact. I wear UA socks and 'roos because I just run hot. I've been doing it for years with great success, compared with cotton alternatives. The problem with these socks is how fast they are wearing out. Unreasonably fast, the seems near the ankles are coming apart. I think its just a flawed design. My older UA socks that I've had for years are still going strong, but starting to wear out. These ones I've only had for weeks. They wont stop me from buying UA, but I wont buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: ocktomas

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt even give these anyway...
customer_reviews.text: Liked these socks at first... the souls had started to fall apart after about a month of wear. I work on my feed alot. 12hr/day 5-6 days a week. Consistantly walked. My feet are rough on socks, but I keep the rough spots smoothed down on my feet to help my socks last. I usually get about 6 months at the least, and a year at the month for my socks. These lasted a month... one month... Under Armour dropped the ball on quality... hard. It a pair of dollar store socks are more durable and comfortable than yours, you have some quality control issues. Any sock brand
customer_reviews.author: Kayla & Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other armour socks
customer_reviews.text: Got these to try as I have other under armor socks that are very good. These are not, first off as far as longevity these are not going to last long as after first wash they are starting to fray. Second they will make your feet sweet and feel slippery. Will not buy these again
customer_reviews.author: I Found Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Zero quality control and performance testing
customer_reviews.text: It's apparent that they bought these socks from a third-party to sell as private label. Unfortunately they did not do any performance testing to see if the socks would hold up to the quality that is expected of Under Armour. Ripped off! The wear-and-tear you see is after just one wearing. Even though I wore these, I will be sending them back. This is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Orr

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, fell apart after first wash.
customer_reviews.text: These things are falling apart after the first wash... What happened Under Armor? First your boot and now your socks? Your quality has gone way down. Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I have several UA product and I have come to expect a certain level of quality with their stuff. These socks are very comfortable but the quality control is horrible. Several pairs are inconsistent in quality and material. Some parts of the socks are super thin. I am not sure how these passed inspection. I contact UA customer service and was told they can’t help me since I bought the socks from Amazon and not from them directly. Thumbs down to UA customer service. I will be contacting Amazon for exchange or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Seven P.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Wearing Under Armour Sock
customer_reviews.text: My teenage son needs extra large socks and the UA Resistor 3.0 crew socks do not disappoint. Unlike Under Armour’s other socks (cotton), these polyester blend socks do not wear out in less than a year. The UA Resistor 3.0 stand up to all he does from wearing cowboy boots daily, to cutting firewood, to hiking in the woods, and all the ways an outdoors loving teenager can use and abuse socks. His feet do not stink in these, he doesn’t wear out the toes and heels in these, and they never slouch in him. A great product all around and better pricing than UA’s site with a military discount. Really, these socks are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chloie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic socks!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. This is the second time we bought the same product. He loves them. He has size 14 feet and thicker legs. They fit him great but not too big or too small. Just the perfect amount of stretchiness. They are true crew sick lwngth. If anything a tiny bit longer. They hold up wash after wash and don’t get those little pilly balls on them like some material does. Fantastic socks!
customer_reviews.author: Donna C.

customer_reviews.title: Socks come apart after one wearing!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, this is after only one wearing. Happened on two pair so far so I will call and try to return them. I have had excellent experiences with UA socks before but not with these. I wear sneakers almost every day and alwys with these types of socks. I’ve never had a pair show this type of wear after one use. I couldn’t believe it so tried with a second pair - same results.
customer_reviews.author: sblang

customer_reviews.title: Great for Disney!
customer_reviews.text: As a size 14, they are a little more snug than I normally like my socks, but man do they work. I bought these for a Disney trip on a recommendation from MouseSavers. I wore a pair every day I was in the parks. They really helped with the moisture and odor of a week of an intense amount of steps. Keeping my feet dry really seemed to help prevent blisters too. I think I only had one the whole vaca. These have now become my go to socks for any event where I know I'm going to be walking a lot. Used them again for LARPing this past weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Dameon

customer_reviews.title: Worse Under Armour product I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: The fit was fine. The black part of the socks were well made; however, the gray part, which is the heel and toe, pilled almost immediately. I have purchased thousands of dollars of Under Armour merchandise since their inception. These socks are the worse Under Amour product that I've purchased, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeping up with the Calves
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a plumber, works in sewage, outdoors, etc.. he needed socks that hold up well. I purchased 2 packs of these for him and he said so far they are extremely comfortable and hold up on his calves very well and he doesn’t sweat as much in them. They are very soft. He’s a shoe size Men 13 and I purchased the size Large for him.
customer_reviews.author: Celina

customer_reviews.title: not as good as Jockey
customer_reviews.text: Hubby said these felt tight on his toes and made his feet feel like they couldn't breath, looks like I get a package of men's socks to wear. Heard people say how much they liked the under armour products so I was surprised that they didn't work out for him. He ended up buying Jockey and is very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: taadis

customer_reviews.title: What, are plastic clothes that much cheaper to make??
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of polyester due to the inherant properties (melting onto skin, lack of softness and breatheability etc.) I gave these a shot because I thought UnderArmor might do it right but when I wore these they just trapped moisture in my boots (compared to underarmor cotton workboot type socks) They get really hot while working in the sun (wet friction) and overall are gross. I cant understand why people would prefer to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: DIYguy

customer_reviews.title: Product slipping
customer_reviews.text: Getting wholes every other wear. What happened to these socks?! They use to be great.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Brady

customer_reviews.title: Super socks for long shifts in ER
customer_reviews.text: These socks are snug without being excessively tight and maintain their elasticity for hours on end. I wear them at work as an ER nurse on 12 hour shifts. They also cushion my feet well.
customer_reviews.author: Chazman

customer_reviews.title: Just right crew socks that can work with several outfits.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase made four months ago. I had tried some Dickies socks, but it was like they had too much cotton (oddly enough). And they were too tight on the top of my foot. I returned them (which is something I have only done a couple of times before). These Under Armour socks have the just right mix of natural and synthetic materials. I wear them in steel toe boots about every day. However, I have also worn them several times with khakis or a suit. The color and texture work very well. If I had to do it over again, I would buy the exact some ones.
customer_reviews.author: Texan4Auburn

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you think.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for socks for your toddler, these are gonna be great. In the picture one sock is unworn and unwashed. The other has been worn once and washed once. You can see the obvious shrinking. They didn’t go up as high on my calf as expected but that’s not the worst problem. I was the dummy that bought 3 packs of these socks purely because I trusted the brand. Also the way they are packaged creates holes in some of the socks, so you get to toss one to four socks per pack in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Ridge

customer_reviews.title: Shoddily made and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These started looking thready and frayed after wearing and washing them ONCE. After a couple of months of light wear, they are literally falling apart. They were also never very comfortable to begin with -- they were somehow too tight around the middle of my feet, and my feet are not wide.
customer_reviews.author: Fivetissimo

customer_reviews.title: Very good general socks
customer_reviews.text: Quality socks, not the cheap thin version. I work in a hospital, so not out in the dirt with work boots all day. I like the shorter version that only goes up half way on calf and these have not fallen apart or lost their elasticity. Weight of cotton is just right. They don't have the compression function for those who may require that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Soft, nice socks
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband because he desperately needed new socks, he already has UA ones, but these are different. Super soft and comfy, but one started falling apart the first time he wore them. Seems like a manufacturing defect, which is fine, but now he has an odd number of socks lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not ALL Socks the Same Size !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these socks before & they are great. Reordered same as some were wearing out. Latest order had at least two (2) pair out of six (6) that were "Small", not "Large" despite being marked on the sole of the sock. These "Small" pair were tight on the foot and short in length up the leg. Your QC people need to pay closer attention to how your products are being manufactured and labeled !!!!
customer_reviews.author: George Holder

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed - but ok I guess
customer_reviews.text: I don't have huge feet and there is nothing special about my dimensions - but I've already torn two socks just putting them on. Will be going back to find the gold toes I passed up on trying something new with these. It was a mistake. I cannot recommend these socks.
customer_reviews.author: S. Aschoff

customer_reviews.title: Stinky.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my partner. They fit him good and are comfortable on him. However, they are only good for a 1/2 day of wearing. They make his feet stink and regular cotton socks do not. I will not order them for him again. I would have returned them but he wore them all and put them in the wash-- silly man.
customer_reviews.author: N. B.

customer_reviews.title: Tore up on first wear all of them out of 2 packs
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two packages of these socks. Usually my husband loves under armor products and gets a pretty good wear life out of them. But these started tearing up first wear! Threads hanging loose causing the socks to come apart. We thought well maybe one pair it happens. But every pair of socks was this way. A waste of money since they could not be worn!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brindley

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 and these in medium are a perfect fit. I definitely do not prescribe to the 1 size fits all, which always gets me ill fitting sock with a bunch left over in the heels. These cup my heel perfectly and wear well inside of boots. Quality wise, the socks are fantastic and are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: VDo

customer_reviews.title: Not what we expected
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES Under Armour socks and we bought some that look similar to these a while back and they are amazing, but very worn out. We wanted to give these a shot because the description was exactly what the last ones said regarding length, etc. These are described as a higher/longer sock. They are not...they barely come to the bottom of his calf muscle and he's very short in stature. They have no stretch so they can't even be pulled up. Also, the quality is not the same even though they're the same brand. If you like thin, below calf socks then you'll like these. However, if you like longer socks, don't get these!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I should’ve followed the reviews. These are definitely a cheaper version of UA socks. My husband has been wearing UA socks for the past 9 years. Decided to buy these and they are already falling apart after just a few months. Highly disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this item!
customer_reviews.text: I figured Under Armour would have a good product.I buy and like their hats.These socks are truly a horrible buy!They are so thin.A plastic baggie would be better on your feet!About the same thickness.Not only are they paper thin but they are about 3 sizes to small.Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good appeal or design. Mostly polyester.
customer_reviews.text: A little scratchy at first but I think cooler. Could have washed first to soften. I think because mostly polyester for scratchyness. Good quality. Once on it doesn't bother me. Usually a fan of mostly cotton. Polyester included wicks moisture and keeps feet dry and not getting rotten or athletes feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best sock EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Under Armour products! These socks have lasted 10x’s longer than any other sock I’ve bought. I work in a shop and wear steel toe boots that seem to alway tear though socks. Usually socks will last me about a month before my toe blows out of them. Not with these, I have pairs of Under Armour socks that I’ve had for a year and there still good, no holes.
customer_reviews.author: bryan2103

customer_reviews.title: The Socks Fall Apart With Less Than a Day of Wear
customer_reviews.text: Just as many others have stated these are hit or miss. I had a perfectly good set and then these. I'm not sure if these are knock offs or Under Armour had a manufacturing issue on some batches. They are very comfortable regardless, but it's not practical for a one day use I would buy in store until this gets resolved.
customer_reviews.author: j3

customer_reviews.title: Suspect they are knock offs
customer_reviews.text: The socks took about 2 weeks to get delivered. I have worn this model sock as my everyday sock for about 3 years, my last set of 6 lasted about 9 months. When these socks did arrived it was evident that the quality I am used to just wasn't there. I looked closely at them and noticed the stitching that makes up the Under Armour logo on the top of the foot doesn't match the stitching on the ones I am replacing. Also the size markings usually found on the bottom of the foot are not there. They also lack the snug fit I am used to. I would avoid ordering these from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Youngs

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Super slippery, foot slipped off carpeted step and fell on my back. Only washed 3 times and a hole on the side above heel. Would not but again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are unbelievable. Super comfy, feels so great that I was delighted when I first slid them on. I ended up replacing ALL of my gym socks with these socks. What makes them so good? 1. Great fit. 2. The foot padding is very comfortable. As someone with plantar fasciitis, this is very important to me. Its nice padding that absorbs shock with not bulking-up underfoot or feeling weird. 3. Really seems to whisk away foot-sweat, even in the thicker pad part. Could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Thomas Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Good sock
customer_reviews.text: I live in a tropical climate and where work boots all damn day. These socks are good for heat. They have lasted me a long time. The older lay I have have not faded. I have worn a hole in the big toe are after years Of service.
customer_reviews.author: barstowkid

customer_reviews.title: You’re buying the brand.
customer_reviews.text: I came across two other sock brands that became my staples. Wanting to try something new and generally finding UA to have a great product line I wanted to try their socks. However, compared to both my other brand and another new brand I tried out this year - the UA socks came in last. This isn’t to say they’re bad socks, they’re fine in fact but they don’t stack up against anything else I’m currently putting on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. They have plenty of cushion for the bottom of his feet, but the band is a bit snug around his legs. (He does have really thick calves so this is a common occurrence) I would definitely buy these for him again.
customer_reviews.author: EllieG

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my time !
customer_reviews.text: Really? These did NOT fit my husband.......they're more appropriate for a 8-10 y/o ! Size: LARGE.... They are too small and WAY WAY TOO TIGHT......he had one sock on for 5 minutes and it left a red mark all around the lower calf. Had trouble putting them on AND taking it off. Very poor quality. Have yet to return.....so DISAPPOINTED. ugh
customer_reviews.author: SuperFleek

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and supporting.
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific socks and although I was skeptical about how supportive they were going to be. As soon as I put the first pair on I could feel a difference. The socks fit well and my back didn't hurt from standing all day. Also, these socks helped me to keep my feet dry. But, most of all, I found that they didn't bind at the top as most socks do.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best socks
customer_reviews.text: I bought the low cut version this fall and tthey feelt great. I was a little worried about the longer version hoping they don't cut off my calves circulation. They are perfect. No tightness and smooth and soft material. Love these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sorto

customer_reviews.title: These stay up
customer_reviews.text: I hate sagging socks which is why I really like these. They can be a bit bulky for dress shoes but are great with sneakers. I marked them don on durability as I do find that they start to split at the seams before they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Greg V.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the $$
customer_reviews.text: These are nice socks for a great price. Not quite as thick as the same brand we paid $12 a pair for in sporting goods store. I’m thinking we will buy these again if they are still available when we are needing more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: Idk what the bad reviewers are taking about. These socks are great. They're my favorite for working out, running, work, petty much anything. They're durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Feagley

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: Am very satisfied with these socks--they're comfortable, durable, and breathe, allowing my feet to stay dry and odor-free. I ordered the XL size (since my feet are size 13) and they fit perfectly without being either too tight or too loose. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Best socks ever
customer_reviews.text: These socks hold up. I have been using 2 pairs I purchased over a year ago regularly and they are just as they were when I first got them after 30-40 wearings... So I purchased more!
customer_reviews.author: Trickyric

customer_reviews.title: For people on their feet all day
customer_reviews.text: If you are on your feet a lot these socks are worth the expense. they compress your feet just right to keep them from hurting when on your feet all day. I have huge caluses and trouble with my feet hurting, but since I switched to underarmor, they don't hurt anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Aray

customer_reviews.title: Good UH Product
customer_reviews.text: Been using these since early March 2019. I noticed some strange pilling around the embroidered UH symbols but it has not got any worse since first washed. So far these socks fit and perform like my other UH products. I recommend their products for consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Rail Bum

customer_reviews.title: Spandex Socks?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the true purpose of these socks are. They stretch out when you put them on. If you need a thin crew socks for tight fitting shoes or boots these may do.
customer_reviews.author: tailu66

customer_reviews.title: 2.0’s are better
customer_reviews.text: Great look, but terrible feel and breathe-ability. Used to wear the 2.0’s, but decided to try the 3.0’s and will never buy another set of 3.0’s. Will definitely go back to the 2.0’s. The 2.0’s could last 12-16 hours in work boots, never smell, feet stay dry, and last about 2 years. The 3.0’s start to smell after only an hour or two, cause a pool of sweat in work boots, feet are wet for so long that toes turn pruny, and last for a month before a hole starts.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Gaskin

customer_reviews.title: Sizing seems a little off.
customer_reviews.text: I like these socks, but this most recent pack I bought seemed like the size was a little larger than the prior ones I’ve purchased. I purchased mediums and generally wear women’s 7 1/2 to 8 shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Nice socks and a good value package.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of these socks. I appreciate the option for an XL size and find they truly fit me well. (I wear a size 16 shoe) The first ones I ordered over a year ago still fit well/have not stretched out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the Under Armour name
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed. These have all sorts of loose threads after washing. (Picture is after 3rd wash, but was that way after the first). The get smelly easily. But at least, they are pretty comfortable. Still, would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L

customer_reviews.title: Under Armour > Nike
customer_reviews.text: Replacing and getting rid of all my Nike socks. These made it easy. Nice and gripping fit, not too thick. I dont use them for athletics, just regular every day wearing. I have more specialty socks for athletics.
customer_reviews.author: A2

customer_reviews.title: ... husband and he really likes them they fit very comfortable and they hold up pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Update: waste of money they wore out quick I mean very quick I would recommend them to anybody. Not worth the money for sure. Bought these for my husband and he really likes them they fit very comfortable. They fit as expected not tight at all.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: So so quality
customer_reviews.text: Pretty thin socks. Little to no support. The cotton frayed from pulling out the plastic binding. Sure hope they hold up. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can’t wear these socks out
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a year ago for my teenager and they look and perform like they are new socks still. I am amazed. Well worth the money. Now if they could only figure out a way to keep him from losing them!!
customer_reviews.author: Nia

customer_reviews.title: Dry feet with a cancer risk.
customer_reviews.text: My guy loves these. There not to thick/not to thin! Material and make alot better than competetors.(besides the Disclaimer) Keeps feet dry in his work boots. Read legal disclaimer about chemicals causing CANCER/ BIRTH DEFECTS!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: Falling apart after a single use and wash
customer_reviews.text: I had a good experience with a more expensive version of Under Armor socks, so I gave these a try. I wore one pair on an average day of runnig errands and then washed them. When I pulled then from the wash, I thought they were inside out. They were not inside out, the socks were frayed and unraveling. None of the other brands of socks in the same laundry load had this issue. None of my other socks (REI, Addidas, etc.) have had this issue before or since, and some of them are quite old. I am not sure if I recieved a bad batch or these are a cheap knock-off.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe N.

customer_reviews.title: solid and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Great all purpose socks that are comfortable and hardy for me. I tend to tear through socks. A pack of 6 will last me around 12 months give or take a couple weeks
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Detonator

customer_reviews.title: Not for Viking calves
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was ordering larger size socks and they turned out to be for chicken legged people. Super narrow and cutting the circulation off my muscular legs. Good material and all but if you have Viking calves don’t buy these...
customer_reviews.author: Berto

customer_reviews.title: Quality is awful!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these exact socks from the Under Armour store for years. Purchased these socks from Amazon for my teenage son on July 8th and after a few washes, on August 3rd they look like shag carpet! I've never seen socks do this before after years of washing. I am beyond disappointed!!! Would never buy these from here again.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good socks!
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Not very thick though. Wouldn’t recommend for cold weather. Definitely a summer or a sports sock. True to size.
customer_reviews.author: Tony McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Time for a redesign.
customer_reviews.text: Worn twice, washed twice, knitting in the sole coming undone and a hole at the ankle. Thought product would've been improved since the 2018 reviews, but hey, at least they're inexpensive. Also, larger sized socks have very short stretch at the top, had to cut a slit to relieve pressure from short elastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kew

customer_reviews.title: Great brand, great socks, great price
customer_reviews.text: I love the under Armour brand. Was surprised that these were so affordable. Ordered them and was very pleased. Have been wearing them almost every day. Very comfortable, good support, and seem to be very durable after the first month.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: Best socks hands down..
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought my first pair of these socks at a dicks sporting goods store. They now have replacement my whole sock drawer. Very comfortable and up to any task. I use them for military duty, sports, weightlifting, anything in general to be honest. Reading some of the reviews I cant help but think some of these people are running on rocks with only their socks on.. I've never had any tear or abnormal wear other than the normal signs of use with any sock. The day one pair is too worn, simple, I'll buy another pair. For the versatility, these are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Viera

customer_reviews.title: Thick & Comfy.
customer_reviews.text: My husband requested i buy him walmart brand socks. I found this pack of Under Armour socks and not only were they cheaper, but they last way longer. He wears his socks until they fall off his feet and these are much more durable than what he would of purchased for himself. I even steal them and wear them myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rued

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: These are the best socks for the cost. I wear boots daily in my line of work and will buy these again over buy any more Hane's or Fruit of the Loom.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Davis

customer_reviews.title: polyester, non-breathable socks
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased the cotton version of these socks -- I thought I was repurchasing them, but apparently I didn't look close enough. Unfortunately these socks are almost 100% polyester. The difference is huge. The cotton version were thick and comfortable. These are much thinner and worse, the material is not "breathable." They also seem to shrink significantly after washing.
customer_reviews.author: RobW

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I honestly have a hard time believing these are authentic Under Armour socks. I’ve owned these exact socks for years, purchased from the UA store. However, the ones I just received from Amazon are horrible quality. Thin. Already threadbare after a few times wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Durable work boot socks
customer_reviews.text: I use these socks everyday as a police officer for the last 6 months and they're still going strong. No holes, no residual stink, no pilling of the fibers. It's a great buy for your money!
customer_reviews.author: Jan1192

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these. He is picky about socks (all his clothing really) but these are comfortable and the seams don’t irritate him. We will definitely be purchasing again
customer_reviews.author: Delena

customer_reviews.title: unfussy, durable thus far, sock
customer_reviews.text: Son likes the socks. Simple "design", easy to get on and off the foot. Hopefully, these will last. Many other pairs of socks from various makers wear in the heel or break down wayyyy to quickly for the price. These have been put to the test the last little bit and are still bright white, no signs of wear or product/construction breakdown.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Bowman

customer_reviews.title: awesome socks, plush and well made
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks for my son. They are well made. After many wash, they are still plush. yes please, its hard enough to find anything that doesnt make holes after one wash. I love these.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Worst socks by UA
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of use I have holes wire in multiple pairs. I bought enough to last 3 weeks before washing, so I'm not over wearing them. More do I do work that requires me on my feet alot. These are aweful. Highly disappointed. 10 years I've used ua socks due to high quality... clearly not these.
customer_reviews.author: Stitch J. E.

customer_reviews.title: My new go to travel black socks!
customer_reviews.text: My new go to travel black socks! Cushion bottom, snug no binding fit. I’m on my feet all day in dress shoes and these are amazing. They are not too thick or thin. They wick moisture away and so far seems to dry out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior DIY-er

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I found these socks to be well made and comfortable. I have washed them a couple times and unlike previous reviews, mine have held up well. They are not too thin, but not thick, just perfect. Will be buying again soon.
customer_reviews.author: jhuffman

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars, because all of the socks are not the same length. So you have to hold them side by side to match them
customer_reviews.author: Chris Black

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mens crew socks.
customer_reviews.text: Under Armor comes through again. I bought these for a trip, where I needed Quick dry, but also comfortable, and. good support. These fit the bill. And they seem very durable. The best mens crew length socks I have worn in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: gasoffmd

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: Utter crap. I would have been better off spending my money on a hammer to hit myself in the head with. One wear and they are disintegrating. Not just one or two pairs... Every single one. I just bought bad disposable socks. Which is heartbreaking because my UA socks I got a year ago have been nearly indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and perfect for workouts!
customer_reviews.text: Great socks! My teenager loves them and they are very durable! These are lightweight,but still plenty warm for winter! Perfect workout sock,because they are breathable! I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan M

customer_reviews.title: Must be knock offs.  Cuffs all stretched out after one washing.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these black and grey UA socks in the store from Scheels and they were great! So I ordered what appears to be the same socks here on Amazon. Well I threw them in the wash before wearing them and all of the cuffs stretched out so they will not stay up. These are definitely not the same socks. Knock offs or, UA switched mfgs in Chyna. I do not recommend, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after wearing once.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but quality is trash. Falling apart at the seams after wearing them once. I bout the crew socks and the ankle socks. Same result. Wear once and done. I have other under armour socks that have lasted much longer and we’re very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Patchadams

customer_reviews.title: The best socks I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These Under Armour Resistor socks are the best. Super comfortable and last forever. Even after many many cycles through the wash, these socks still have some cushion and are soft. Absolutely love them. I also have the ankle version and they are identical quality. Probably take years before I see a hole in any of these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The elastic does not cutoff circulation
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of these socks. I would purchase them again when needed. Under Armour Resistor 3.0 Crew Athletic Socks has a fine texture with durable material and elasticity. It is clear that the polyester is a trait of the best socks provided by Under Armour.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Good support, and comfortable but probably needs more cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I like these socks. They are great for the price, and offer good support for athletics, but I kind of wish they had a little more cushioning. I'll probably look for similar socks to try and find a good fit!
customer_reviews.author: John Goodman

customer_reviews.title: good product value
customer_reviews.text: some complain about the product durability and while they are not made of Kevlar I have not been disappointed with the product given what I paid, I got what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy A

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and soft
customer_reviews.text: I wear a women's 8.5 to 9, I ordered the medium and they fit perfectly. Extremely comfortable, I'm on my feet all day long and they are very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good set of comfortable socks with decent thickness inability to stay up all day.
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfortable fitting thicker socks. They're not too tight where they leave imprint but they do stay up well.
customer_reviews.author: TeckFreek

customer_reviews.title: Under Armor socks
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my son. He is on her s feet all day walking. He says they stay up and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: joni

customer_reviews.title: Soft, Good Value, Durable
customer_reviews.text: Super soft and comfy, wick the sweat away well for all day comfortable wear. Wash and dry well without skrinking
customer_reviews.author: Kim L.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Comfort and Quality. They breathe quite nicely -- almost like a dress sock -- though I'd not expect them to wear any more quickly for it. Might not work for those using them for daily marathons, but an otherwise brilliant everyday sock.
customer_reviews.author: C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: They fit my son's huge, wide feet bit didn't stretch out permanently like other socks usually do...but would also be great for"normal" sized feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ashgirl

customer_reviews.title: Best socks I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: My feet tend to sweat, but not with these bad boys. They wick moisture like my own personal trainer dabbing sweat from my water-laden brow. I like them so much I bought them twice.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Coffaro

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good socks
customer_reviews.text: These are actually some of the most comfortable socks ive purchased. They stretch where needed and they arent tight. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diablo

customer_reviews.title: Actually fit smaller feet.
customer_reviews.text: Only men’s socks that I have found that aren’t a “one size fits all” type of garbage. I have small feet for a man (size 8) and these socks actually fit correctly instead of the of the sock siting high on my ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Wayne Atkinson

product_meta.title: Under Armour Adult Resistor 3.0 Crew Socks, 6-Pairs
product_meta.description: Under Armour brand mission is to make all athletes better through passion, science and the relentless pursuit of innovation. Today's athlete demands a sock that not only represents the look and feel of the brand, but that simultaneously provides useful, technical attributes bridging the gap between style and functionality.
feature_bullets: Dynamic arch support helps reduce foot fatigue
Anti-odor technology helps prevent odor in the sock
Material wicks sweat and dries fast
